chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted payment plan of $25.00 per month to begin 11/1/2022, to include this case and 22CF62 and 22CF32

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:15 PM Defendant Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez in court.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Ubaldo NMI Garcia Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Susan Rascon, previously sworn as interpreter.   Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived their right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of their own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered their plea, knowingly, intelligently and of their own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.
